mesh: beads-native swarm orchestration (cx + jj)
description:
Goal: upgrade `codex/skills/mesh/SKILL.md` so any agent can reliably coordinate a swarm of sub-agents to complete a bead (typically an epic) using Beads primitives + cx spawning + jj workspaces.

Key design constraints (decided):
- Operate at epic-children level via `bd swarm status/validate`.
- If given a non-epic bead, allow `bd swarm create <bead>` auto-wrap (1-child epic) but do NOT auto-beadify/split; if parallelism is needed, use gen-beads first.
- Sub-agents are ephemeral and spawned via the `cx` skill.
- No shared beads state across jj workspaces: sub-agents do NOT run `bd`; the coordinator writes bead comments + agent state.
- Canonical coordination:
  - assignment: `bd slot set <agent> hook <bead>`
  - liveness: `bd agent state/heartbeat` (coordinator-updated in this mode)
- Isolation: `jj workspace add` per bead at `../workspaces/<repo>/<bead-id>/`.
- Done means: PR opened + coordinator records PR + verification in bead comments.
- Scheduling: propose an ordered heuristic (priority → unlocks → checkpoints → manual), but always ask for a cap when spawning.

This epic is a planning/implementation container. Child beads should be independently PR-able, and the graph should allow parallel drafting with an explicit integration/join bead.
close_reason: Completed: all child beads merged; mesh SKILL.md runbook integrated with example

title: mesh: contract — entrypoints, scope, target selection
description:
Define and document how the mesh coordinator chooses what to swarm.

Focus:
- Supported inputs (explicit epic ID, current bead, list of bead IDs).
- Default behavior: epic-first; if non-epic is provided, allow `bd swarm create <id>` to auto-wrap into a 1-child epic.
- Scope confirmation protocol (avoid accidental wide fanout): require the user to confirm the epic + child list before spawning.
- Explicit statement that mesh does NOT auto-beadify (no automatic splitting into children); it expects a good DAG already.
- Guidance for the “only one child / no parallelism” case: stop and recommend using gen-beads to create child beads + deps.

Deliverable: an updated section in `codex/skills/mesh/SKILL.md` describing these contracts and the exact bd commands to use.

title: mesh: contract — scheduling + wave selection (priority→unlocks→checkpoints→manual)
description:
Define and document the mesh scheduling algorithm.

Decided heuristics (in order):
1) `bd` priority first.
2) Maximize unlocks (prefer contract/high-fanout beads).
3) Prefer checkpoint/integration beads when they are ready.
4) Always allow/encourage manual pick; mesh should present a recommendation, not silently spawn.

Also capture:
- No default concurrency cap: coordinator must ask the user per wave.
- Wave planning from `bd swarm status` (Ready/Blocked/Active/Completed), plus optional `bd swarm validate` for “fronts”.
- Contention rules: avoid overlapping diffs; serialize beads that touch same files; optionally mention `bd merge-slot` as a merge/conflict primitive.

Deliverable: a scheduling/wave-planning section in `codex/skills/mesh/SKILL.md` with an explicit, actionable decision procedure and a status summary format.

title: mesh: implementation — agent lifecycle via bd agent + bd slot (coordinator-only bd)
description:
Document how mesh represents and tracks sub-agents using Beads, given the “no shared beads across jj workspaces” constraint.

Key behaviors to encode:
- Coordinator creates an ephemeral agent bead per spawned sub-agent run:
  - `bd create --type=agent --ephemeral --role-type polecat --agent-rig <rig> ...`
- Coordinator attaches the work bead to the agent using the hook slot:
  - `bd slot set <agent-id> hook <bead-id>`
- Coordinator updates agent liveness/state:
  - `bd agent state <agent-id> spawning|running|working|stuck|done`
  - `bd agent heartbeat <agent-id>` (optional)
- Because sub-agents do not run `bd`, the coordinator is responsible for writing progress:
  - per-bead comments (PR link + verification signal)
  - epic-level “swarm status” comment aggregating PRs/blockers/next wave
- Cleanup guidance:
  - clear hook slot when done
  - optionally close or delete ephemeral agent beads

Deliverable: a concrete runbook section + command snippets inside `codex/skills/mesh/SKILL.md`.

Workstream: Mesh Beads Integration
Role: implementation
Parallelism impact: unlocks 3 beads
Rationale: slots+state provide durable coordination even without shared bd access.

title: mesh: implementation — jj workspace + cx dispatch recipe (per-bead workspaces)
description:
Document how mesh spins up per-bead jj workspaces and launches cx-based sub-agents in the correct working directory.

Decisions:
- Workspace path convention: `../workspaces/<repo>/<bead-id>/`.
- Create with `jj workspace add <path> [-r <rev>]`.
- Launch sub-agent by running `codex/skills/cx/scripts/cx-exec.sh "..."` FROM INSIDE the workspace so code edits land in the right working copy.
- Sub-agent prompt must include enough bead context (copied from `bd show`) so it can work without running `bd`.
- Sub-agent must:
  - use `jujutsu` skill for VCS operations
  - open a PR
  - print a final output block the coordinator can copy into bead comments (PR URL, verification, changed paths)

Deliverable: a “Workspace + Dispatch” section and an agent prompt template in `codex/skills/mesh/SKILL.md`.
